Serialized Form

  • Package org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy

    • Class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ApduRequest extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      877369841119873812L

      • Serialized Fields

        • bytes

          byte[] bytes
          Buffer of the APDU Request

        • case4

          boolean case4
          a ‘case 4’ flag in order to explicitly specify, if it’s expected that the APDU command returns data → this flag is required to manage revision 2.4 Calypso Portable Objects and ‘S1Dx’ SAMs that presents a behaviour not compliant with ISO 7816-3 in contacts mode (not returning the 61XYh status).

        • successfulStatusCodes

          java.util.Set<E> successfulStatusCodes
          List of status codes that should be considered successful although they are different from 9000

        • name

          java.lang.String name
          Name of the request being sent

    • Class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ApduResponse extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      6418469841122636812L

      • Serialized Fields

        • successful

          boolean successful
          the success result of the processed APDU command to allow chaining responses in a group of APDUs

        • bytes

          byte[] bytes
          apdu response data buffer (including sw1sw2)

    • Class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeRequest extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      6018469841127325812L

      • Serialized Fields

        • selector

          SeRequest.Selector selector
          SE selector is either an AID or an ATR regular expression

        • successfulSelectionStatusCodes

          java.util.Set<E> successfulSelectionStatusCodes
          List of status codes in response to the select application command that should be considered successful although they are different from 9000

        • apduRequests

          java.util.List<E> apduRequests
          contains a group of APDUCommand to operate on the selected SE application by the SE reader.

        • protocolFlag

          SeProtocol protocolFlag
          the protocol flag is used to target specific SE technologies for a given request

        • keepChannelOpen

          boolean keepChannelOpen
          the final logical channel status: if true, the SE reader keep active the logical channel of the SE application after processing the group of APDU commands. If false, the SE reader will close the logical channel of the SE application after processing the group of APDU commands (i.e. after the receipt of the last APDU response).

    • Class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeRequestSet extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      6255369841122636812L

      • Serialized Fields

        • sortedRequests

          java.util.Set<E> sortedRequests
          List of requests. Each SeRequest will result in a SeResponse wrapped in a SeResponseSet.

    • Class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeResponse extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      265369841119873812L

      • Serialized Fields

        • channelPreviouslyOpen

          boolean channelPreviouslyOpen
          is defined as true by the SE reader in case a logical channel was already open with the target SE application.

        • selectionStatus

          SelectionStatus selectionStatus

        • apduResponses

          java.util.List<E> apduResponses
          could contain a group of APDUResponse returned by the selected SE application on the SE reader.

    • Class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.SeResponseSet extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      125369841119873812L

      • Serialized Fields

        • seResponses

          java.util.List<E> seResponses
          List of seResponses that were received following the transmission of the SeRequest.
